fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.filter

Interface IFilter

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ILogicFilter, ISearchFilter

    public interface IFilter
    Defines filtering parameters for a data source provided by a connector.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be immutable and therefore completely thread-safe.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IListStructure.buildFilter(), IFilterBuilder.search(String), IFilterBuilder.all(), IFilterBuilder.any()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IFilter and(IFilter filter)
      Creates a composite filter by adding another compatible filter to this filter.
      void exportFilter(OutputStream stream)
      Exports the filter definition.
      <T> T exportFilterAs(Class<T> asType)
      Exports the filter definition as an instance of the specified type, if such a conversion is supported.
      IConnector getConnector()
      Gets the connector that provides access to the data source.
      ISource getSource()
      Gets the data source that provides access to records.

    • Method Detail

      • getSource

        ISource getSource()
        Gets the data source that provides access to records.
        Returns:
        the source.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getConnector

        IConnector getConnector()
        Gets the connector that provides access to the data source. This is the same as calling ISource.getSourceConnector() on the source.
        Returns:
        the connector.
        Since:
        1.0

      • and

        IFilter and(IFilter filter)
     throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Creates a composite filter by adding another compatible filter to this filter. The state of this filter is unmodified by the resulting composite filter.
        Parameters:
        filter - filter to add (using a logical AND) to this filter to create the new composite filter.
        Returns:
        a new immutable filter object.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the composite filter cannot be created, due to the structure or contents of the filters to merge.
        Since:
        1.0

      • exportFilter

        void exportFilter(OutputStream stream)
           throws IOException
        Exports the filter definition.
        Parameters:
        stream - non-null stream to write to. The stream will not be closed by this method.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the definition cannot be exported to the supplied stream.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IFilterBuilder.importFilter(java.io.InputStream)

      • exportFilterAs

        <T> T exportFilterAs(Class<T> asType)
        Exports the filter definition as an instance of the specified type, if such a conversion is supported.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the class parameter and of the returned instance.
        Parameters:
        asType - the specified export type. There is no requirement for implementations to support any conversions other than to instances of String.
        Returns:
        an instance of the specified type, never null.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the requested conversion is not supported by this implementation.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IFilterBuilder.importFilter(Object)
